p_nodesp.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /*****************************************************************************
00002 
00003   Description: This file contains C routines to that create and manipulate
00004                the parameters -- attributes and pointers -- of an object
00005                or group.
00006  
00007   Author:  Randy Davis, University of Colorado LASP
00008  
00009   Creation Date:  12 March 1989
00010   Last Modified:  18 May 1991
00011 
00012   History:
00013 
00014     Creation - This module was introduced in a somewhat different form in
00015     the Version 1 release of the ODLC library.
00016 
00017     Version 2.0 - 30 August 1990 - R. Davis, U. of Colorado LASP
00018       a) This set of routines has been adapted from the Version 1 set of
00019          routines for manipulating attributes.  The routines NewParameter,
00020          RemoveParameter, FindParameter and NextParameter have been con-
00021          structed from the Version 1 routines NewAttribute, RemoveAttribute,
00022          FindAttribute and NextAttribute, respectively.  The function of the
00023          Version 1 routine FirstAttribute is now part of FindParameter.
00024          Routines CopyParameter, CutParameter and PasteParameter are new
00025          for this version.
00026 
00027     Version 2.1 - 13 March 1991 - R. Davis, U. of Colorado LASP
00028       a) Implemented cut, copy and paste routines and changed some of the
00029          other routines to take advantage of them.
00030       b) Added support for comments attached to parameters.
00031 
00032   Version 2.2 - 18 May 1991 - M. DeMore, Jet Propulsion Laboratory
00033     a) Removed include statements that were Unix specific and placed them
00034        in odldef.h.
00035     b) Added intialization of two application specific fields to the
00036        NewParameter routine.
00037     c) Removed unused variables from several routines.
00038 *****************************************************************************/
00039 
00040 #include  <stdlib.h>
00041 #include  "odldef.h"
00042 
00043 
00044 
00045 
00046 /*****************************************************************************
00047 
00048   Routine: NewParameter
00049  
00050   Description: Create a new parameter node and attach it to an
00051                object or group node.
00052  
00053   Input:
00054           aggregate - Pointer to the aggregate node to which the parameter
00055                       is to be attached.  If this value is NULL, the
00056                       parameter node is created but not attached to
00057                       any aggregate node.
00058           kind      - Kind of parameter: attribute (KP_ATTRIBUTE) or
00059                       pointer (KP_POINTER).
00060           name      - A character string containing the name to be given
00061                       to the parameter.
00062  
00063   Output: A pointer to the new parameter node is returned as the function
00064           result.  A NULL value indicates that the parameter could not be
00065           added, probably due to lack of dynamic memory. The NULL value is
00066           also returned if the name input name argument is NULL.
00067  
00068 *****************************************************************************/
00069 
00070 
00071 PARAMETER NewParameter (
00072 
00073      AGGREGATE       aggregate,
00074      PARAMETER_KIND  kind,
00075      char           *name)
00076 
00077 {
00078   PARAMETER  parameter;        /* Pointer to the new parameter node         */
00079   char *string;
00080 
00081 /* >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> BEGIN CN CHANGES >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> */
00082 /* >>>>> MDD 5/18/91  Removed unused variable old_last             >>>>> */
00083 /* >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> END OF CN CHANGES >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> */
00084 
00085 
00086   if (name == NULL)
00087     {
00088       return (NULL);
00089     }
00090 
00091   /* Allocate memory for the new parameter node */
00092 
00093   parameter = (PARAMETER) malloc (PARAMETER_NODE_SIZE);
00094   if (parameter != NULL)
00095     {
00096       /* Copy the parameters's kind and name */
00097 
00098       parameter->node_kind = kind;
00099 
00100       string = (char *) malloc (strlen(name)+1);
00101       if (string == NULL)
00102         {
00103           /* Error: Allocation failed, probably due to lack of memory.
00104              Free up all space and return */
00105 
00106           free (parameter);
00107           return (NULL);
00108         }
00109      
00110       parameter->name = strcpy (string, name);
00111 
00112       /* Initialize the other data fields in the parameter node */
00113 
00114       parameter->comment        = NULL;
00115       parameter->value_kind     = KV_UNKNOWN;
00116       parameter->value_count    = 0;
00117       parameter->columns        = 0;
00118       parameter->rows           = 0;
00119 
00120 /* >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> BEGIN CN CHANGES >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> */
00121 /* >>>>> MDD 5/18/91  Added intialization of two application       >>>>> */
00122 /* >>>>>              defined fields in the parameter structure.   >>>>> */
00123 /* >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> */
00124 
00125 #ifdef PDS_TOOLBOX
00126       parameter->appl1         = 0;
00127       parameter->appl2         = 0;
00128 #endif
00129 
00130 /* >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> END OF CN CHANGES >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> */
00131 
00132       /* Indicate that there are no values for this parameter yet */
00133 
00134       parameter->first_value = NULL;
00135       parameter->last_value  = NULL;
00136 
00137       /* Attach the parameter node to its aggregate node, if any */
00138 
00139       if (aggregate != NULL)
00140         {
00141           PasteParameter (aggregate, parameter);
00142         }
00143       else
00144         {
00145           /* There is no aggregate node to attach to: this parameter
00146              node will stand alone */
00147 
00148           parameter->owner         = NULL;
00149           parameter->left_sibling  = NULL;
00150           parameter->right_sibling = NULL;
00151         }
00152     }
00153 
00154   return (parameter);
00155 }
00156

00159 
00160 /*****************************************************************************
00161 
00162   Routine: RemoveParameter
00163  
00164   Description: Removes a parameter node and all of its values.
00165  
00166   Input:
00167          parameter   - A pointer to the parameter node to be removed.
00168  
00169   Output: A pointer to the next parameter of the aggregate.  The NULL
00170           value is returned if there is no next parameter. The NULL
00171           value is also returned if input argument is NULL.
00172 
00173 *****************************************************************************/
00174  
00175 
00176 PARAMETER RemoveParameter (
00177 
00178      PARAMETER   parameter)
00179 
00180 {
00181   PARAMETER  r_parameter;    /* Pointer to parameter's right sibling        */
00182   VALUE      value;          /* Pointer to parameter's value nodes          */
00183 
00184 
00185   if (parameter == NULL)
00186     {
00187       return (NULL);
00188     }
00189 
00190   /* Remove all the values associated with the parameter */
00191 
00192   value = FirstValue (parameter);
00193 
00194   while (value != NULL)
00195     {
00196       value = RemoveValue (value);
00197     }
00198 
00199   /* Remember the location of the next parameter node for this aggregate */
00200 
00201   r_parameter = parameter->right_sibling;
00202 
00203   /* Detach the parameter node from its aggregate node */
00204 
00205   CutParameter (parameter);
00206 
00207   /* Free up the memory space used to hold the parameter node, its
00208      name string and any comment attached to the node */
00209 
00210   if(parameter->comment != NULL)
00211   {
00212     free (parameter->comment);
00213     parameter->comment = NULL;
00214   }
00215   if(parameter->name != NULL)
00216   {
00217     free (parameter->name);
00218     parameter->name = NULL;
00219   }
00220   free (parameter);
00221   parameter = NULL;
00222 
00223   /* Point to the next available parameter, if any */
00224 
00225   return (r_parameter);
00226 }

00231 /*****************************************************************************
00232 
00233   Routine: FirstParameter
00234  
00235   Description: Returns the first parameter node of an object or group node.
00236  
00237   Input:
00238           parameter   - A pointer to the aggregate node.
00239  
00240   Output: A pointer to the first parameter node is returned as the function
00241           result. The value NULL is returned if there are no parameters for
00242           the aggregate.  The NULL value is also returned if the input
00243           argument is NULL.
00244 
00245 *****************************************************************************/
00246  
00247 
00248 PARAMETER FirstParameter (
00249 
00250      AGGREGATE   aggregate)
00251 
00252 {
00253 
00254   if (aggregate == NULL)
00255     {
00256       return (NULL);
00257     }
00258   else
00259     {
00260       return (aggregate->first_parameter);
00261     }
00262 
00263 }
00264 
00265 
00266 
00267 
00268 /*****************************************************************************
00269 
00270   Routine: NextParameter
00271  
00272   Description: Returns the next parameter of an object or group node.
00273  
00274   Input:
00275           parameter   - A pointer to the current parameter node.
00276  
00277   Output: A pointer to the next parameter node is returned as the function
00278           result. The value NULL is returned if there are no more parameters
00279           for the object or group.  The NULL value is also returned if the
00280           input argument is NULL.
00281 
00282 *****************************************************************************/
00283  
00284 
00285 PARAMETER NextParameter (
00286 
00287      PARAMETER   parameter)
00288 
00289 {
00290 
00291   if (parameter == NULL)
00292     {
00293       return (NULL);
00294     }
00295   else
00296     {
00297       return (parameter->right_sibling);
00298     }
00299 
00300 }
00301

00303 
00304 
00305 /*****************************************************************************
00306 
00307   Routine: FindParameter
00308  
00309   Description: Finds the first parameter of an object or group node with a
00310                specified name.
00311  
00312   Input:
00313          base_node   - A pointer to the aggregate node for which the
00314                        parameter node search is to be performed. 
00315          name        - Character string containing parameter name to be
00316                        located.
00317  
00318   Output: A pointer to the parameter node with the specified name.  If
00319           no match is found, then the NULL value is returned.  The NULL
00320           value will also be returned if either of the input arguments
00321           is NULL.
00322 
00323 *****************************************************************************/
00324  
00325 
00326 PARAMETER FindParameter (
00327 
00328      AGGREGATE   aggregate,
00329      char       *name)
00330 
00331 {
00332   PARAMETER  parameter;         /* Pointer to parameter node                */
00333 
00334 
00335   if (aggregate == NULL || name == NULL)
00336     {
00337       return (NULL);
00338     }
00339 
00340   /* Start searching with the first parameter of the specified aggregate */
00341 
00342   parameter = FirstParameter (aggregate);
00343 
00344   while (parameter != NULL && strcmp (parameter->name, name) != 0)
00345     {
00346       parameter = NextParameter (parameter);
00347     }
00348 
00349   return (parameter);
00350 }
00351 
00352 
00353 
00354 
00355 /*****************************************************************************
00356 
00357   Routine: CutParameter
00358  
00359   Description: Cuts a parameter node and its values from an ODL tree.
00360  
00361   Input:
00362           parameter   - A pointer to the parameter node that is to be
00363                         cut from the tree.
00364  
00365   Output: A pointer to the cut parameter node is returned as the function
00366           value. The NULL value is returned if the input argument is NULL.
00367 
00368 *****************************************************************************/
00369  
00370 
00371 PARAMETER CutParameter (
00372 
00373      PARAMETER   parameter)
00374 
00375 {
00376   AGGREGATE  aggregate;      /* Pointer to parameter's aggregate node       */
00377   PARAMETER  l_parameter;    /* Pointer to parameter's left sibling         */
00378   PARAMETER  r_parameter;    /* Pointer to parameter's right sibling        */
00379 
00380   
00381   if (parameter == NULL)
00382     {
00383       return (NULL);
00384     }
00385 
00386   /* Detach the parameter node from its aggregate node */
00387 
00388   aggregate   = parameter->owner;
00389   l_parameter = parameter->left_sibling;
00390   r_parameter = parameter->right_sibling;
00391   
00392   if (l_parameter != NULL)
00393     {
00394       l_parameter->right_sibling = r_parameter;
00395     }
00396   else if (aggregate != NULL)
00397     {
00398       aggregate->first_parameter = r_parameter;
00399     }
00400 
00401   if (r_parameter != NULL)
00402     {
00403       r_parameter->left_sibling = l_parameter;
00404     }
00405   else if (aggregate != NULL)
00406     {
00407       aggregate->last_parameter = l_parameter;
00408     }
00409 
00410   /* Reset the parent pointer and the sibling pointers in the parameter
00411      node, since this node now stands alone */
00412 
00413   parameter->owner         = NULL;
00414   parameter->left_sibling  = NULL;
00415   parameter->right_sibling = NULL;
00416 
00417   /* Return a pointer to the cut parameter node */
00418 
00419   return (parameter);
00420 }
00421

00424 
00425 /*****************************************************************************
00426 
00427   Routine: CopyParameter
00428  
00429   Description: Copies a parameter node and all of its values.
00430  
00431   Input:
00432           parameter   - A pointer to the parameter node to be copied.  This
00433                         parameter node remains in the ODL tree.
00434  
00435   Output: A pointer to the copied parameter node. The value NULL is returned
00436           if the input parameter pointer is NULL or if storage couldn't be
00437           obtained for the copy.
00438 
00439 *****************************************************************************/
00440  
00441 
00442 PARAMETER CopyParameter (
00443 
00444      PARAMETER  parameter)
00445 
00446 {
00447   PARAMETER        parameter_copy; /* Copy of the specified parameter       */
00448   VALUE            value;          /* Value node currently being copied     */
00449   VALUE            value_copy;     /* Copy of the specified value           */
00450 
00451 /* >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> BEGIN CN CHANGES >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> */
00452 /* >>>>> MDD 5/18/91  Removed unused variable string               >>>>> */
00453 /* >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> END OF CN CHANGES >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> */
00454 
00455 
00456   if (parameter == NULL)
00457     {
00458       return (NULL);
00459     }
00460 
00461   /* Create a new parameter node */
00462 
00463   parameter_copy = NewParameter (NULL, parameter->node_kind, parameter->name);
00464   if (parameter_copy == NULL)
00465     {
00466       return (NULL);
00467     }
00468 
00469   /* Copy the comment attached to the parameter node, if any */
00470 
00471   CommentParameter (parameter_copy, parameter->comment);
00472 
00473   /* Copy the other data fields in the parameter node */
00474 
00475   parameter_copy->value_kind  = parameter->value_kind;
00476   parameter_copy->value_count = parameter->value_count;
00477   parameter_copy->columns     = parameter->columns;
00478   parameter_copy->rows        = parameter->rows;
00479     
00480   /* Copy each value node attached to the parameter.  For error values there
00481      may be none; for scalar values there will be one; for set and sequence
00482      values there may be zero, one or more  */
00483   
00484   value = FirstValue (parameter);
00485 
00486   while (value != NULL)
00487    {
00488      value_copy = CopyValue (value);
00489      NewValue (parameter_copy, &value_copy->item);
00490      free (value_copy);
00491      value = NextValue (value);
00492    }
00493 
00494   return (parameter_copy);
00495 }

00498 
00499 
00500 /*****************************************************************************
00501 
00502   Routine: PasteParameter
00503  
00504   Description: Inserts a parameter node and all its values into an ODL tree.
00505                The parameter node becomes the current last parameter node
00506                of the specified aggregate node.
00507 
00508   Input:
00509           aggregate   - A pointer to the aggregate node to which the
00510                         parameter node is to be added.
00511           parameter   - A pointer to the parameter node to be pasted.
00512 
00513   Output: A pointer to the inserted parameter node is returned as the
00514           function result. The value NULL is returned if either the
00515           target aggregate node or the input parameter node are NULL.
00516 
00517 *****************************************************************************/
00518  
00519 
00520 PARAMETER PasteParameter (
00521 
00522      AGGREGATE   aggregate,
00523      PARAMETER   parameter)
00524 
00525 {
00526   PARAMETER        old_last;       /* Previously last parameter node        */
00527 
00528 
00529   if (aggregate == NULL || parameter == NULL)
00530     {
00531       return (NULL);
00532     }
00533 
00534   /* Place the new parameter node at the end of the list of parameters
00535      for the specified aggregate */
00536 
00537   old_last = aggregate->last_parameter;
00538   if (old_last != NULL)
00539     {
00540       old_last->right_sibling = parameter;
00541     }
00542 
00543   aggregate->last_parameter = parameter;
00544   if (aggregate->first_parameter == NULL)
00545     {
00546       aggregate->first_parameter = parameter;
00547     }
00548 
00549   parameter->owner         = aggregate;
00550   parameter->left_sibling  = old_last;
00551   parameter->right_sibling = NULL;
00552 
00553   return (parameter);
00554 }
